strIntroduction: Halal is not limited to foods and drinks, but also to what we apply on our skins. Halal certificated beauty products must be free of such chemicals like fatty acids, gelatin, alcohol or ingredients that are extracted from animals. Our beauty salon has provided Muslim-friendly beauty services for 4 years in Ebisu. With our professional and skillful stylists, as well as our Halal conscious products, we are confident to bring you an enjoyable moment when experiencing our services here. We offer the following services: - Haircut service: through consultation with customers, we offer a hair cut in any style upon your request, shampoo with a unique technique and high-quality Halal certificated products. We can also blow dry and massage your head and shoulder for 5 minutes. - Head massage: to boost your metabolism, the service starts with deep cleansing carbonated shampoo, only high-quality Halal conscious hair care products are used. Then followed by a refreshing scalp massage and a blow dry. Make-up service: try on Japanese-style makeup by our beauty professionals and a simple hair set upon your request.
strTitle: Visit Muslim-Friendly Beauty Salon in Ebisu, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Akazawa Onsen is a famous resort hotel located near Akazawa Beach. It is like a theme park and there are a lot of facilities for health and beauty, such as spas, pools, gymnastic, bowling places, an aesthetic salon, and health supplement products in Japan. Akazawa Onsen is often chosen as one of the country’s must-visit hot springs, seeing extensive views of the ocean from the open-air hot spring bath. In the evening, you can enjoy taking a bath under the beautiful stars as well. During your stay at Akazawa Onsen, you can use a lot of quality cosmetic products and amenity goods of DHC brand at the onsen, spa, pool, gymnastic, and also for the heavenly spa. This two in one package plan of using Aakzawa spa, along with a 90-minute aromatic body massage, is really popular among men and women. This will be held in a private space and you'll be able to enjoy a nice garden view. The spa treatment service combines techniques from all over the world, such as Ayurveda and stone therapy. Your guest room will also be equipped with a Japanese style open- air bath, so you can enjoy bathing as well! So get ready and spoil yourself with this heavenly spa course and enjoy the blissful moment to your heart's content!
strTitle: Treat Yourself to a Heavenly Spa, in Shizuoka

strIntroduction: Zao Onsen is one of the most famous sulfurous hot springs in Japan. The hot, natural volcanic waters will relax and refresh your body and mind. Located in Yamagata prefecture, about 30-40 minutes from Yamagata city by car, the Zao Onsen snow resort is known for excellent powder conditions, a wide range of courses covering a large area and the famous Juhyo "Ice Monsters." Onsens can be found at ryokans in the village, and one of the ryokans is Chikusenso. The gardens at Chikusenso, which occupies an area of 20,000 square meters within Zao Quasi-National Park, faithfully reflect nature in Zao. The winding river, the waterfall, the deciduous forest reflecting the changing seasons, and rustling bamboo groves are all there for guests’ enjoyment. The inn’s buildings, based on the “modern Japanese” architectural concept, make abundant use of natural materials such as wood, stone and washi (Japanese paper) to create a calm, healing atmosphere. Interiors were designed by Yukio Hashimoto, who created the décor for The Peninsula Tokyo and other notable buildings. The inn’s 32 luxurious rooms combine the best of Japanese hospitality with the functionality and conveniences of a modern hotel. The inn offers guests tours of a sake brewery, a cheese-making factory, and a chance to experience the tea ceremony and other aspects of Japanese culture. Relaxation in an open-air bath or spa treatments in pristine natural surroundings provide healing experienced by all five senses, making your stay at Chikusenso an unforgettable one. Chikusenso offers a special solo trip plan. The plan includes a 90-minute seasonal treatment, and welcome drink champagne. For men, the treatment can be changed to East & West blend treatment. The following conditions apply: * Dinner and breakfast are included. * The onsen room is open 15:00 – 24:00 and 6:00 – 10:00. * The private open air bath can be used. Make a reservation after you arrive at Chikusenso.
strTitle: Relax at a Famous Hot Spring & Luxurious Ryokan, in Yamagata

strIntroduction: It's summer time, the season of festivals! This tour allows you to experience the famous festival in Aichi, the Toyohama Sea Bream Festival. It's also known as one of the most unique festivals in the world. It's said that the festival started around 1890, when a carpenter created the float in a shape of a mouse to make their festival exciting. In the beginning, the shapes of the float were animals. After time had passed by, the shape transformed into sea creatures. Since the area is famous for the fishing industry, it's natural to have the float with the theme of sea creatures. In the beginning of the Taisho period, people created sea bream shaped floats. In the beginning of the Showa period, a float had people inside, playing a drum, a flute and a shamisen (Japanese traditional three-stringed instrument). People carried the float and walked throughout the town, and even went to the ocean. This style of the festival remains true today. The completed float weighs one ton and requires about 60 people to carry it. We're certain that you'll be blown away by the festival. A tour guide will take you from Nagoya to Toyohama, so you can relax and enjoy the ride. The tour is operated in the afternoon on July 23rd and 24th. Details of the schedule need to be confirmed.
strTitle: Explore Toyohama Sea Bream Festival, in Aichi!

strIntroduction: This origami workshop takes 1 hour. Basically, I will teach you how to fold paper and make simple origami such as "samurai helmets", "Ninja throwing knives", "paper balloons", and more. If you like, I can teach not only these simple ones, but also "Flapping cranes", "Jumping frogs" as you can see on the movie . This would be perfect for souvenirs from your trip to Japan. Let's enjoy folding origami while hanging out and listening to Japanese traditional music! Some tea and snacks are included. Besides, it is easy to visit the venue from Narita Airport. 6 people at the most can take part in this gathering a time.
strTitle: Make your own origami souvenir from Japan

strIntroduction: This is a 3 - 5 hour tour at Asakusa, Tokyo. Asakusa is one of the best traditional sightseeing places in Tokyo. You'll feel the old Japanese culture at this place. It's very popular and we will take a commemorative photo during this tour. I'll pick you up at Asakusa Station (if you need me to pick you up from your hotel, an extra charge will apply). Go to the Kaminarimon gate and take a commemorative photo in front of the big gate. ↓ Shopping at Nakamise Street. ↓ See Asakusa's temple which brings luck to visitors. ↓ Experience making a Japanese candy figurine at a local shop. Duration: 3 - 5 hours Participants: 2-8 Day of the week: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday Meeting point: Asakusa Station (if you need me to pick you up from your hotel, an extra charge will apply) Time: (1) 10:30- (2) 13:30- I'm looking forward to seeing you in this tour!
strTitle: Make a Japanese candy figurine during a tour in Asakusa

strIntroduction: This is a private tour around Narita, so you can choose what you want to see and where you want to go. Below are the highlights of the tour: Narita Narita city is about 10 minutes from Narita Airport by train. There you can visit Naritasan Temple and its Japanese traditional garden. You can wish and pray for your success at the temple. There is also the shopping street, where you can get various souvenirs and experience eating soba or sweet broiled eel at the Japanese restaurants. Sawara Sawara is about 30 minutes from Narita by train. You can wear kimono and walk around the old streets, or cruise by boat through the river. If you want, you can go to Katori Shrine (it would be better to use taxi from Sawara Station). Some other experiences include: - see sake (rice wine) brewery and taste local sake - wear kimono and have your hair set made - see a festival float museum - cruise by boat through the river Sakura Sakura town is about 15 minutes from Narita by train. You can visit an old samurai residence and also explore the National Museum of Japanese History. You can also see the ruins of the Sakura Castle. You can have tea ceremony at a teahouse.
strTitle: Enjoy a Private Tour in Narita, Sawara, and Sakura (Chiba)

strIntroduction: “Shima Kanko Hotel the bay suites” is one of the resort hotels in Shima city, Mie prefecture, where all the 50 rooms are suite rooms. The hotel is facing Ago Bay at Ise Shima national park and the beautiful architectural buildings are surrounded by the richly greened garden where you can walk and pick some herbs. The food at the restaurants in the hotel is mainly seafood from the bay and the sea nearby together with local seasonal ingredients. With this plan you can either choose French seafood or Japanese kaiseki (Tea ceremony dishes). Both restaurants have huge windows facing the bay, so you can enjoy the sunset at dinner time. The highlight of this hotel package is its spa treatment. “eau spa by Clarins” is the first resort Spa in Japan. Clarins is one of the most popular skin care brands in Europe and all treatments are done by hand with Clarins products. At first, you will make a booking for your treatment. The treatment begins with a counseling by a therapist. The treatment will be discussed and decided depending on your condition on the day. Starting with a foot bath you will then have an aroma massage treatment. Your legs, back and shoulders will be softened by the therapist’s hands with aroma oil! After the treatment, you can relax with herbal tea and the therapist will give you some advice for simple treatments at home. Then you can just relax in your room until dinner time or you might want to go for a stroll to feel the new freshness of your body. *Check-in:15:00 / Check-out:12:00 Option 1 Stay at the hotel with Spa treatment for 60 minutes. *2 meals are included. *5/17/2016-9/30/2016
strTitle: Book a room at resort hotel with Spa treatment in Mie!

strIntroduction: Sayama, rich in natural beauty, is one of the three highest quality tea producing regions in Japan which also is the nearest tea planting area to Tokyo (located in Saitama prefecture). This hands-on experience of hand-rolled tea making is also available. Inside the souvenir store, you can buy the freshest tea. This tour starts with a lecture about tea processing and the skills of picking tea leaves, then you can pick leaves by yourselves before tasting a Japanese cuisine made with tea leaves. Other optional services are also available. For example, you can try on the traditional tea-picking clothing or you can learn how to pick and pack tea leaves in a container by yourself. Please ask the staff for more information if you intend to book these optional services. In addition, you can book hotel pick-up as an additional option. However, please note that transportation is not included. Attention: This tour only operates during early May to mid-October.
strTitle: Experience the Wonder of Picking Tea at Miyano-en, Sayama

strIntroduction: Wellness Hotel with farm, “Fufu Yamanashi” is a unique facility where guests can forget about the labors of every day’s life and focus on a healthy lifestyle and it is operated by medical specialists cooperating with local farmers to provide the best setting for good sleep, excise, healthy diet, and relaxation. There are various interesting programs such as a walking in the woods program which includes bathing in the morning sun to reset your biological clock. Morning yoga will remind you of the benefits of a workout and deepening your breath. “Karada Reset Program” or body reset program is helpful for having great posture and enhancing your inner muscles. In addition, there is a program to experience farming! Guests can help with cultivation or picking vegetables, providing a rare chance if you are a city dweller. In addition, healthy meals are served, called “therapy food” using seasonal ingredients, especially vegetables in a French full-course style. Guests can eat plenty of vegetables, do some moderate exercise, and commune with nature in a beautiful environment! There is no better place for unwinding than this. Spend your holiday at Fufu Yamanashi! ●Room Fufu Yamanashi has Japanese-style rooms with tatami and futons as well as Western-style rooms with beds. Every room is equipped with a bathtub and shower, but you can try an open air Jacuzzi to immerse yourself in its luxury! ●Optional Menu Fufu Yamanashi prepares optional programs such as “therapy walking in the woods,” “trekking Mt. Konara needs an advance reservation. ●Price includes: 5 set programs/ Meals/ Amenities ●Access Pick up at 11:30 or 14:00 at JR Enzan Station of Chuo Main Line (About 90 minutes by express train "Azusa" or "Kaiji" from Shinjuku to Shioyama Station )

strIntroduction: The Port of Kobe is a famous tourist spot in Kobe. This tour is a two-hour cruise tour that provides you with traditional Japanese food like Monjayaki or Yakiniku. When people think of Japanese food, most think of sushi. However, you probably don't know, but another of Japan’s popular dishes is something called Monjayaki. Monjayaki is simple but complicated! It has just a few simple ingredients and can be made in under three minutes. However, it requires detailed instructions to make. Details of this tour: 1. Departure will be from the No.4 station of Kamomeria at the Port of Kobe. 2. Kobe Port Tower can be seen from the start. 3. It takes about 10 minutes to get to the Hyougounga. 4. The meal is served after the arrival of the Hyougounga. 5. You can also enjoy a lot of other tourist spots from the boat. 6. The meal ends 15 minutes before the return. Options: 1. A buffet of Monjayaki (adult) 2. A buffet of Monjayaki (child) (age 3-12) 3. Yakiniku with one drink (adult) 4. Yakiniku with one drink (child) (age 3-12) 5. Wagyu with one drink (adult) 6. Wagyu with one drink (child) (age 3-12) Attention: 1. The whole tour is around 2 hours and starts three times a day. Morning: 11:00-13:00 Afternoon: 15:00-17:00 Evening: 18:00-20:00 2.Last order is 40 minutes before return. 3.The price includes the ticket and meal. 4.You can also enjoy an all-you-can-drink for 90 minutes by adding 2,000 JPY for each person. 5. Minimum 2 people booking in advance. 6. This tour starts at a minimum of 10 peopleT
strTitle: Try Monjayaki or Yakiniku on a Yakata Boat in Kobe

strIntroduction: The unique feature of Hayato Salons is that the majority of the staff is bilingual, having been trained in either NY or London. The stylists at Hayato Salons are experts in managing foreigners’ hair types. Only the stylists who undergo our academy's 48-course stylist training program, developed for over 20 years by Hayato, fulfill a set number of practical training on models determined by our salon, and meet the criteria set by the directors, debut as Hayato Salons' stylists. We are not just particular about the quality of our services, but also about our creative techniques. For a maximum relaxation for the customers, we developed our own method of secondary shampoo, in addition to the standard shampooing technique. We, believe that “people become beautiful when the inner and outer beauty harmonize”. Increasing number of Japanese women, like Western women, are becoming more independent. With more women receiving higher levels of education and entering the workforce, many of them are assuming high-power positions similarly to men. As such, many women are under a great stress. New York, London, Roppongi, Harajuku, Omotesando and Hakone are where Hayato Salons are located. We aim to offer services beyond what customers expect from a typical hair salon and have many customers who have enjoyed their time throughout the world.
strTitle: Experience hair salon with Omotenashi, Hayato Tokyo

strIntroduction: We run the historical road tour of Kokufu-cho by bicycles. We will pray at several temples included in the 88 temple pilgrimate of Shikoku. In addition, we will visit a Shinto shrine. Kokufu-cho was a state's capital in the ancient times. There are many remains showing that the place prospered. Ancient buildings are reproduced in the park. We will visit the park and will feel the atmosphere of the ancient times. There is also a pond with springing water. Let's spend a happy time in Kokufu-cho, Tokushima city, by cycling!
strTitle: Enjoy cycling tour of the historical town Kokufu, Tokushima!

strIntroduction: You can appreciate the masterpieces of the world art at the unique Otsuka Museum of Art in Tokushima, Shikoku. More than 1,000 masterpieces are exhibited on a magnificent scale. The world's first ceramic plate paintings are reproduced in ceramic boards of the original full size. Not only masterpiece paintings, but also the entire Sistine Chapel Ceiling is reproduced! Picasso's son and the staff of international museums of art have visited this place and have praised the museum and its works. Audio guide players are available in four languages: Japanese, English, Chinese and Korean. You can listen to 6 commentaries on time periods and about 100 commentaries on paintings. To see all the paintings of 1,000, you must walk a route of about 2.5 miles!
strTitle: Visit the unique Otsuka Museum of Art in Shikoku

strIntroduction: We will meet at Shuri monorail station, and then go to the workshop. It takes about a 15-20 minute drive from Shuri monorail station to the workshop. In the workshop, many items from famous local artists are on display and can be purchased. Sayoko Kinjo, who has a 15-year career in Okinawa as a Bingata artist, will teach all the classes. Many of her works are displayed in hotels in Okinawa. During this tour, you will have the chance to make an original bingata tote bag. The time required for this workshop is about 4 hours. *This tour can start at any time from 9:30 to 13:30 (Monday to Saturday) *The maximum allowed for each group is six people. *Please contact us for availability.
strTitle: Enjoy Traditional Bingata (Okinawan Dyeing) Experience, Naha

strIntroduction: We'll meet at Shuri monorail station in Naha, then we will go to the karate museum. It takes about 20-30 minute by car from Shuri monorail station to karate museum. The museum is on the second floor of a karate dojo. You can see many old photographs and old karate items on display. The curator is a famous calligraphy teacher whose calligraphy is sold at a high price in a shop near the Shuri Castle. Only here customers can buy calligraphy works at a special price! You can order your favorite word written on wood or paper by calligraphy. After that, I will take you back to Shuri monorail station. The time required for this tour is about 2 hours. This tour runs between 10:00 and 16:00 (on Tuesdays and Saturdays: 10:00 to 15:00). Let's enjoy a wonderful time together at the traditional karate museum while learning more about Okinawa's history!

strIntroduction: The day will consist of a tour around the World Heritage, the sacred Mt. Fuji, shopping at Gotemba Premium Outlets, the largest outlet shopping center in Japan and a visit to a hot spring with a panoramic view. We will pick you up at your accommodation and depart at 8:30 am. Course-1 (morning): The tour will start from one of the most stunning view points of Mt. Fuji famous for its five-storied pagoda at Arakurasengen Park. We will move to see the pastoral landscape of Oshino Hakkai with old style Japanese houses and a total of eight ponds formed from the beautiful groundwater of Mt. Fuji. The name “Hakkai” meaning eight seas actually represents the ponds that were originally used for cold showering for the pilgrims in the Edo era. We will be taking lunch at a local restaurant. Course-2 (morning): The tour will start form the 5th Station of Mt. Fuji - the most popular and easiest starting point for climbing. You will see the enormous mountain from its 2300-meter high view point. If the weather condition is good enough you will see the sea of clouds. We will have lunch at Tokimekino Fuji restaurant that offers a variety of local meals using organic foodstuff that are cultivated on their own. Afternoon: We will move to Gotemba Premium Outlets, the main event of the day - the largest outlet shopping center of japan. You will have free time for shopping for about 2 hours and 45 minutes. The day will end in at a hot spring with a panoramic view of Mt. Fuji. ※If you are hesitant bathing with other people tell me so, I will arrange to have more sight seeing or spend more time at the outlet. Important notice: Due to road closures for private cars at the 5th station between July 11th to August 31th and from December up to the end of heavy snow season, we will offer alternative plans such as visiting shrines, walks around Lake Kawaguchi, visiting the ice caves, activities at the Ninja Village or other options you wish to request. We can customize the course to suit your needs.
strTitle: Visit Fuji Gotemba Premium Outlet and relax in a hot spring

strIntroduction: The day will consist of a tour around the World Heritage, the sacred Mt. Fuji. You will discover not only the beauty of the mountain, known as a source of art, but also visit places where pilgrims stopped over during the Edo period (17-19th century) before their pilgrimage to the divine mountain. The first eruption of Mt. Fuji started about 100 thousand years ago. It then took 90 thousand years to form its symmetric shape and become the highest mountain of Japan reaching 3776 meters or 12388 feet - our symbolic mountain. As a characteristic of stratovolcano, its beautiful symmetrical shape has inspired lots of artists and foreign visitors over the past centuries. It is recorded that the earliest pilgrimage to Mt. Fuji started around the 8th century. In the middle of the 14th century, during the Sengoku period (Japanese Warring States period), Kakugyo became the patriarch for the pilgrimage we know today. This folk religion spread rapidly as the country was in an unstable state. It was then followed and revised in the next 400 years. After the death of Kakugyo, people from all over the country formed groups or clans to make their pilgrimage preserving the following beliefs: 1. Doing good will bring you good, if you do bad then things will turn bad 2. If you work you earn and become rich, stay away from disease and have a long life 3. If you are lazy you will be poor, sick and live a short life This tour is not just a sightseeing but is designed to have a more diverse perspective by discovering history, culture, religion and values of the people that are all related to Mt. Fuji. The course will end at a hot spring which is a typical way of relaxing and communicating at the end of the day. ※If you are hesitant bathing with other people tell me so, I will arrange to have more sight seeing. Important notice: Due to road closures for private cars at the 5th station between July 11th to August 31th and from December up to the end of heavy snow season, we will offer alternative plans such as visiting shrines, walks around Lake Kawaguchi, visiting the ice caves, activities at the Ninja Village or other options you wish to request. We can customize the course to suit your needs.
strTitle: Beautiful views of Mt. Fuji and worship history with onsen

strIntroduction: Offering beaches, resorts, together with mountainous sceneries, Shodoshima Island in Seto Inland Sea is well-known for its Mediterranean atmosphere. Traditionally known for producing soy sauce, now the island is even better known for the biggest olive cultivation in Japan. On this tour you can visit the 500 or so, wild and playful monkeys that currently inhabit the area known as the Monkey Kingdom. Visit Kankakei Summit, one of three of the most beautiful gorges in Japan and enjoy the breathtaking view from the observation decks along the ropeway while having lunch. Visit Nijushi no Hitomi Movie Village, a 30-year-old movie set with old fashioned backgrounds and a nostalgic atmosphere. End the tour by visiting an olive garden and discover all the ways olives are used or soak your skin in an olive bath.

strIntroduction: There is nothing more perfect than escaping from the hectic bustle of Tokyo to the peaceful and breathtaking natural scenery of the Northern Japan Alps! On this 2 days tour you will have the chance to get on Shin-Hotaka Rope way and to experience snowshoe hiking in Kamikochi area this winter! This wonderful winter journey starts from Matsumoto Station, where you will take the Shin-Hotaka Rope way to the Nabedaira Kogen affording views of the Northern Alps from 1,305 m altitudes. After arriving at Nabedaira Kogen, you will take a snowshoe hiking lessons for 2 hours before taking the Shin-Hotaka Rope way to Shin-Hotaka Onsen Station. After such a long day, you will have dinner and stay at Hotel Hotaka, an A-class ranked hotel in Shin-Hotaka Onsen area. On the second day explore the Kamikochi area and have a snowshoe hiking from Kama tunnel to the vicinity of Taisho Pond. Explore the beauty of the Northern Alps and enjoy the great view of Kamikochi's nature while hiking with snowshoe! After snowshoeing for 5 hours, rejuvenate yourself by dipping into the hot springs at Hirayu Onsen! Relieve all of the tense muscles with the natural warm water and relax yourself before returning to Tokyo! The Itinerary for the tour is as follows: Day 1 - Meet at Shinjuku Station South Entrance at 7:40-8:40 - Take the limited express train "Azusa" to Matsumoto Station - Take the Shin-Hotaka Rope way to Shin-Hotaka Onsen Station - Take the No.1 Rope way to Nabedaira Kogen to take the snowshoe lesson - Take the Shin-Hotaka Rope way back to Shin-Hotaka Onsen Station - Stay at Hotel Hotaka Day 2 - Depart from Shin-Hotaka Onsen Station to Kamikochi area by bus - Guided snowshoe hiking from Kama Tunnel to the vicinity of Taisho Pond (5-hour walking) - Take the bus to Hirayu Onsen and dip into the hot springs - Take the limited express train "Azusa! to Shinjuku from Matsumoto Station - Tour ends in between 21:00 and 22:10 Don't forget to bring the following things with you to join this tour: - Waterproof hi-cut shoes (mountain-climbing shoes or snow boots) - Rubber boots, fabric trekking shoes, and sneakers are not appropriate for snowshoe hiking. - Waterproof outerwear (separated tops and bottoms) ・Gore-Tex® rain gear ・Snow (Snowboard) wear, etc - Leggings (for mountain climbing and trekking) to prevent the snow entering the shoes - Glove, goggles/sunglasses, winter snow cap - Comfortable hiking shoes and clothes that protect you from cold weather. Lunch are not provided, so please bring your own lunch for two days. Bread is difficult to freeze, so we strongly recommend you to bring bread for your lunch. Please note that the tour is for Japanese citizens and basically operated in Japanese. Although we have staff speaking both English and Chinese, only basic information is provided, not a detailed guide about the sights. In addition, children under 12 years old cannot participate in this tour for safety reasons.

Walk Through Beautiful Flowers in Heidi's Village, Yamanashi

strIntroduction: Kamikochi is a popular resort in the Northern Japan Alps of Nagano Prefecture, offering some of Japan's most spectacular mountainous scenery. It is open from mid/late April until November 15 and shuts down during winter. In 2016, Kamikochi is scheduled to be open until November 15. Kamikochi is a roughly 15-kilometer long plateau in the Azusa River Valley, about 1,500 meters above sea level. It is surrounded by tall mountains, including Nishihotakadake (2909 m), Okuhotakadake (3190 m), Maehotakadake (3090 m) and the active volcano Yakedake (2455 m). Part of the Chubu Sangaku National Park, Kamikochi has only been moderately developed with half a dozen hotels, a few souvenir shops, mountain huts and hiking trails. Private cars are banned from Kamikochi, and access is only possible by bus or taxi. Why not take a trip from central Tokyo to Kamikochi? The tour fare includes the round trip JR express ticket (day trip), and direct bus from Matsumoto to Kamikochi or train from Matsumoto to Shin-Shimashima + bus (You can choose whichever).
strTitle: Walk Around the Natural Environment of Kamikochi, Nagano

Mother Farm is a year-round destination, with a different character in different seasons. Why not take a trip from central Tokyo or urban Chiba to Mother Farm in Futtsu city? strTitle: Touch and Play with Live Animals at Mother Farm, in Chiba!

strIntroduction: This is a half day tour to the Ohya underground lake inside an old quarry. The lake was formed by rain water that was filtered through the ground into the old site of a quarry that was active for more than 67 years. It is more than 20,000 square meters and large enough to fit a baseball field. The quarry was well known in the area for being the site where a lot of the stones were took to build the Imperial Hotel designed by the master architect Frank Lloyd Wright. After a through inspection of the site conducted by the government, it was deemed safe for exploration, allowing only organized tour groups to visit the site, which remains off-limits to individual visitors. This mysterious place is near Utsunomiya, located two hours away from Tokyo by car and less than one hour by Shinkansen bullet train. The tour starts at 9:15, you will meet your guide at Michi no eki in Utsonomiya romantic mura at parking place number two, from where they will take you to the quarry. Pick-up is also available from Utsunomiya Station at 8:40 am. For afternoon tours the meeting time is 12:40 at Utsunomiya Station or 13:20 at Michi no eki. You will start by hiking the mountain of the quarry for approximately 500 meters, with amazing views, then, you will hop on a rafting boat in a 8 people group and paddle your way through the peaceful, and mysterious darkness of the underground lake. At some places the route can be thrilling because of the low ceiling. The light flickering in the darkness enhances the mysterious, fantastic atmosphere. After the tour, you will head back to Michi no Eki Utsunomiya romantic mura by bus and arrive around 12:40 pm (after 17:00 pm for afternoon tours). Take this unique opportunity of cruising an awe-inspiring space in silence and darkness and experience the wonderful world of the underground lake in the quarry.
strTitle: Experience the Ohya underground lake in a quarry by raft!

strIntroduction: Okinawa is Japan's southernmost prefecture, consisting of a few dozen, small islands in the southern half of the Nansei Shoto, the island chain which stretches over about one thousand kilometers from Kyushu to Taiwan. Okinawa is gaining international popularity. Coral reefs provide great snorkeling and diving spots, but if you prefer to see beautiful fish without getting wet, Okinawa also has a fine aquarium. This is a convenient one day bus tour that lets you explore some of the best Okinawa has to offer. The tour starts at 10:00 at Chatan Tourist Organizaion, and will head to Kouri Island, where you'll have time to explore the beautiful Kouri beach along with the lengthy bridge extending 1,960 meters across the sea. Enjoy the beautiful view of the turquoise blue sea. Then, from the bus, admire the Warumi Ohashi Bridge before reaching the Churaumi Aquarium, where you'll have 3 whole hours to explore thoroughly this impressive aquarium allowing you to discover the unique underwater life of Okinawa including the massive whale sharks and cute dolphins. The tour then moves on to Okinawa Fruits Land if you take the tour on an odd number day, where you can taste some unique tropical fruit that grow in Okinawa. if you take the tour on an even day, you will visit Nago Pineapple Park instead, where besides pineapples, you will also be able to try a variety of sweets, wines and many more products. You will also be able to ride on the pineapple kart to explore the farm. Finally, for an extra charge, you have the option to visit Kokusai street in Naha, where you can shop around for souvenirs and tasty treats!
strTitle: Enjoy a 1 day tour to most popular attractions in Okinawa

strIntroduction: This is a 1 day bus tour, that takes you to Shuri Castle, the Navy Underground Headquarters, the Himeyuri Monument, the Peace Memorial Park, Okinawa World and Gyokusendo Cave departing from Naha! Spend a whole day exploring beautiful Okinawa! The tour will pick-up you up at 9:00 from the designated hotels: Okinawa Miyako Hotel and Hotel Nikko Naha Grand or you can arrive at Naha bus office and check-in there for the tour. The bus will take you to Shuri Castle, designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2000. It was the home of the Ryukyu kings and the center of culture, politics and diplomacy of the Ryukyu Kingdom during 1429 - 1879. It features vivid red, yellow and blue colors that represent the traditional Okinawan culture. *Entrance to the interior of Shurijo castle is optional. The tour will then move on to the Former Japanese Navy Underground Headquarters; built in 1944, it is said that the headquarters was 450 meter long at that time, now 300 meter of the headquarters are open to the public, where you can see many interesting areas such as the operation room, the code room, the medical room, the chief commander's room, etc. It is a very important and significant place to learn about the history of Okinawa. You will then visit Himeyuri monument, and after the visit you will have an hour to enjoy a delicious lunch included in the tour. *Depending on your tour date, the location for lunch will differ. (Odd number days) Himeyuri Kaikan (Even number days) Yuubi-do Then, you will be able to relax in the amazing natural landscapes of the Peace Memorial Park, where you can see the 'Cornerstone of Peace' at the Peace Memorial Museum, a memorial inscribed with the names of 240,000 people fallen on both sides of World War II. *Entrance to the Peace Memorial Museum is optional. You will then be taken to the Gyokusendo Cave, visited by millions of tourists every year and known as the "most beautiful cave in Asia". This natural wonder is 5000 meter long and it is one of the biggest caves in Japan. It's located inside Okinawa World, a theme park where you can experience Okinawan culture by strolling through an Okinawan village or a tropical fruits garden, by watching the Habu (yellow spotted lance-head snake) show or an Okinawan dance, among many other activities. Drop-offs at following locations: -Okinawa Miyako Hotel -Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle. -Kokusai Dori Bus Stop -Naha Bus Terminal
strTitle: Explore south Okinawa's nature and history on a bus tour

strIntroduction: Japanese calligraphy has its roots in ancient China. Through the writing of these complex characters, the Japanese have developed their own technique and writing style which has a strong decorative component. Calligraphy as artwork has a close relationship with the natural world, the temperament of people and the country's philosophies. Many believe that these elements are the key differences between Japanese and Chinese calligraphy. At the lesson, you can learn about the basics of Japanese calligraphy such as how to use the "fude" brush and black ink container, "suzuri". The challenging part is making the strokes in the correct order and moving the brush with just the right amount of pressure on the thin paper. At first glance, it may seem easy, but this art requires perfect concentration and timing in order to correctly write the next stroke. As you write, you may feel the spiritual state of nothingness that embodies Zen meditation. Many Japanese people thoroughly enjoy this feeling and believe it is vital to their self-development and emotional control. The aroma of the ink may help you relax and your writing position can help improve your posture. All of these factors contribute to the idea that calligraphy is good for one's personal health. Learning how to write calligraphy with passion, patience and creativity is great for people of all ages and makes a great souvenir. Write your own favorite words and take part in this unique cultural experience.
strTitle: Experience the Ancient Art of Japanese Calligraphy in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: “Utsue” Waterfalls This site is about 17 km away from Takayama Station, 30 mins by car. It is designated by the Japanese Government as one of the 100 most beautiful natural scenery in Japan. It is especially beautiful in autumn when leaves change their color. The area of 800 Ha is a natural park at 1,300 meters altitude. There is a viewpoint to see the Japan Alps at 880 meters altitude. There are almost 13 different waterfalls within 1 hour walking distance. Some of them are more than 15-meter heigh. The area has also beautiful a trekking course of 1.5 km. “Hana no Mori” Flower Park This flower park is located next to the Utsue Waterfall. It features a variety of Japanese flower blooming in different times of the year. It is only open from late-May to early-August. Among the highlights are 10,000 plants of “Bamboo Lily” in June-July, 150,000 plants of “Japanese Primrose” in May-June, 5,000 plants of “Hydrangea” in July-August. You can also see flowers such as “Asian Skunk Cabbage”, “Golden Lace”, “Sweet Flag”, “Japanese Stewartia” in the park. The tree species you can find in the park will be “Magnolia”, “Japanese white birch”, “Horse Chestnut”, “Japanese Cedar”, “Japanese Oak”, etc. “Yuyukan” Hot Spring (Onsen) This is a simple alkaline hot spring facility, located near the “Utsue” waterfalls. 6 types of indoor bath facilities and 3 types of open-air bath facilities are available. There is a waterfall shower (pelting water), stone sauna (good for anti-aging and smooth skin by intense perspiration), salt sauna (detoxing skin by salt), bubble & Jacuzzi bath, infrared sauna, etc. Complete experiences of Japanese “Onsen” is assured here.
strTitle: Enjoy Takayama's nature:13 waterfalls, flower park and onsen

strIntroduction: Shinto is the main religion believed and practiced widely by most of Japanese people, together with Buddhism. If you understand the basics of Shinto Shrine principles and practices, you will understand Japanese cultural context better. Hie-Shrine is located a bit far (20-25 mins walk) from Takayama Station, thus it is less visited by tourists. Without seeing the crowds of tourists, we can learn together and observe the Torii Gate, Shimenawa rope, donation, praying, purifying yourselves, Komainu liondogs, lanterns, fortune telling, etc. Zen temples are rather rare in Takayama, but we can pick one of the Zen temple in the northern part of town that offer Zen practice classes for any visitors. Finally, the Sukyo Mahikari Headquarter building is very visible from anywhere in Takayama, as it is huge and outstanding architecture that draws everyone's attention. We are dare enough to actually make a visit to the main hall of this newly developed religious sect's (new age type of religion) magnificent building. Pick-up at 9AM / 2PM Send off at 1PM / 6PM (4 hours tour)
strTitle: Experience Zen: Spiritual and meditating moments in Takayama

strIntroduction: Tea ceremony is one of interesting experiences that you can participate in during your visit in Takayama: to feel the old days Japanese samurai warriors' spiritual meditative practices. Festival floats are magnificently exhibited in Matsuri no Mori museum where you can observe wonderful decorations and craftsmanship of each float (or portable shrine). In this museum, we can watch the actual puppets performances (automated), actually practice the manipulation of puppets by your hands, and see the world largest flat Japanese drums (Taiko) performances. If you want to refresh in a hot spring onsen, we can stop at the high quality hot spring spa facility of the 5-star hotel Associa Takayama. If you still want to explore the traditional folk culture further on that day, we can make another stop at Hida folk village to observe traditional houses and gassho-style houses in this very popular open-air museum.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese traditional cultural experiences in Takayama

strIntroduction: This museum is probably the most holistic, global, biggest and extensive museum among the 100 museums existing in Takayama, but because of its location, it is the least visited museum as well. It covers Western classic/contemporary arts, Japanese paintings, calligraphy, sculptures, performing arts, dinosaurs, ethnicity, costumes, Egyptian/Asian civilization, and a lot more to offer! As most of the exhibits have their instructions in English, and you can spend almost 2-3 hours to see all the works in detail, I can simply drop you at the museum, and pick you anytime convenient for you. So, it is a self-guided tour in the museum. I really recommend visiting this museum, especially when you have 2-3 hours to spare in Takayama, nothing else to do or you got bored with all the traditional places of the small town. This museum is very big!
strTitle: Visit the hidden gem HIKARU museum in Takayama

strIntroduction: We will take you deep into Tokyo by bicycle. You can go back and see the Edo period even Japanese people do not know these places very well. This tour goes around some historical places on east side of Tokyo. This area is old downtown area. The atmosphere of old Tokyo still remains. Yoshiwara is the place where young girls used to work as prostitute. Yoshiwara does not exsist as a town any more, but still you can see some remains. Sanya is the place that helped the high economic growth period of Japan and the location of the famous cartoon ‘’Tomorrow’s Joe’’. Do you know Shiki Masaoka?? He is a famous poet. Visit his house where spent his last years and get to know his unique personality. After sightseeing, take coffeebreak at a world famous coffee roastery. Have lunch at Uenosakuragiatari. This the little-known spot is a renovated traditional house which is now a modern shop. Course: CYT→Yoshiwara→Jokanji Temple→Namidabashi Bridge→Nihondutsumi→Ueno→Shikian→CYT Edit
strTitle: Cycle to Tokyo's past with a local neighbourhood ride

strIntroduction: In this tour, you can enjoy jaw-dropping night views from Mount Rokko! Since Mount Rokko can be reached by a complicated transportation route, it is very troublesome and difficult to get there on your own. Your English guide will be a big help to experience this unforgettable sightseeing tour! Don't miss this chance to see Rokkosan's night view, that is well-known as the "Million-dollar Nightscape"! You can choose either Shin-Kobe Station,where the Shinkansen bullet train stops, or Sannomiya Station, which is in the center of Kobe city, as your meeting point. (Hotel pick-up is also available as an additional-option for this tour). You can enjoy the Million-dollar Nightscape from the observatory, soon after you take the cable car from the foot of Mount Rokko. The night view from Rokkosan is unforgettable with its fascinating scenery! At Rokko Garden Terrace, you can not only see the beautiful night view but also eat a delicious dinner and enjoy shopping to buy some souvenirs to your family and friends! It is one of the most popular panorama observation spot in Japan, where you can see Akashi strait, Osaka plain, and Kansai International airport. The night view from the Rokko Garden Terrace is jaw-dropping, it's a must-visit tourist spot when you visit Kobe! There are several restaurants available for your dinner, such as: Granite Cafe, Rokko View Palace, and Jingisukan Palace. An especially recommended restaurant would be Rokko View Palace, where you can observe the fascinating night view while you enjoy your dinner! Enjoy this valuable tour with an English guide to upgrade your trip in Kobe! This tour is available everyday. Itinerary: Meeting Point 1: Shin-Kobe Station Meeting Point 2: Sannomiya Station (15 min train ride from Shin-Kobe Station) *You can choose Shin-Kobe Station or Sannomiya Station for your meeting point. *Hotel pick-up is also available for this tour. Get on the bus at Rokkodo Station and head to Rokko Cable Shita Station (30 min) Ride on the cable car to Rokko Sanjo Station (10 min) Enjoy the observation deck at Rokko Sanjo (20 min) Take the bus to Rokko Garden Terrace Station (10 min) See the beautiful night view, Enjoy your dinner & Buy souvenirs at Rokko Garden Terrace! (150 min) Get back to Rokkodo station by bus and cable car (40 min) Drop-off Point 1: Sannomiya Station Drop-off Point 2: Shin-Kobe Station The price only includes Guide Fee. In addition to the price, other fees might cost depending on your tour. Transportation Fee: Meeting & Drop-off point 1 [Sannomiya Station] (Adult Age 12 & over) 2260 JPY (Child:Age 6 -11) 1140 JPY Meeting & Drop-off point 2 [Shin-Kobe Station] (Adult Age 12 & over) 2680 JPY (Child:Age 6 -11) 1360 JPY
strTitle: Enjoy Rokkosan Night View Tour with English Guide in Kobe!

strIntroduction: Koiwai is a 7,400-acre farm located amid the scenic splendour at the base of Mt. Iwate. Famous for its dairy produce, Koiwai is a popular tourist destination, attracting around 750,000 visitors every year. Koiwai is also famous for its lush and expansive forest. In this guided tour (Japanese-speaking guide only), you will learn everything about the unique forestry methods at Koiwai and discover how people and nature co-exist. You'll feel the cool breeze as you ride through the forest on this nature adventure. Your friendly guide will also tell you all about the diverse wildlife that live there. The meeting and ending point for this tour is at pastoral Makiba Park with its many attractions. Price include admission, tractor ride, Japanese-speaking guide and fee. All major credit cards accepted. Children under 5 may participate free of charge if carried. • Add-on: Guided Kamimaru cattle barn admission - additional fee. Meeting and drop off point - Makiba Park. Short Course: 40 minutes Start times: 10:00; 13:00*; 14:00; and 15:00 daily (check in 10 mins beforehand) *weekends and holidays only Long Course: approx. 60 minutes meet 10:50, end 12:00 daily. Access: Free parking available for 30 large buses and 2,300 standard cars. Arrivals by bullet train (Tohoku or Akita) or train (Tanzawa line), transfer to Bus at Morioka Station, platform 10 bound for "Koiwai Farm Makiba Park", or take the bus from Koiwai Station.
strTitle: Explore a Hundred-Year-Old Koiwai Forest, in Iwate!

strIntroduction: Enjoy this self-guided tour from Kumamoto by bus. In Nagasaki, you will stay at a comfortable, clean and modern Nagasaki Bus Terminal Hotel.The hotel is perfectly located to explore Chinatown, one of the largest in Japan. You'll be able to browse the fascinating shops and restaurants of this vibrant, colourful area. There are also classic shopping arcades of the historic Dejima area where you can find souvenirs to take home. The hotel also makes for a great base from which to explore this amazing city to your own personal agenda, pace, and interests. For example, this great budget package is equally ideal for experiencing the nightlife in Nagasaki, or viewing the city from the top of the hills. While in Nagasaki, you should also try the local noodle dishes: champon and sara udon! With so many cultural and gastronomic delights to offer, Nagasaki is a great place to visit. Of course, visitors to the city are always encouraged to visit the Nagasaki Peace Park to consider the futility of human conflicts, and the horror this has led to in the past. Far from being a depressing and unsettling experience, this permanent exhibition and memorial, and indeed the city of Nagasaki itself, is a testament to hope and renewal in a spirit of peace and harmony.
strTitle: Experience a Self-Guided Tour of Nagasaki, for Couples

strIntroduction: On this tour, you can fully enjoy Okinawa by visiting Churaumi Aquarium Ocean Expo Park, Okashi Goten, Nago Pineapple Park or Okinawa Fruit Land, Manza Cape, and Ryukyu Village! This is a must join tour if you'd like to see the depths of Okinawan culture and its famous tourist spots all in a day! Churaumi Aquarium Ocean Expo Park is one of the largest aquariums in the world! You can see 8.6 meter whale sharks and families of manta rays in the 22.5 meter wide water tank! You can also see the many corals that grew up in the aquarium for more than 10 years. Since Churaumi Aquarium uses tons of seawater, the living creatures grow up healthily and naturally. Okashi goten is a huge Okinawan sweet shop where you can buy popular sweets including Okinawa's famous purple yam tartlets. With its smooth texture and the great aroma of the purple yam it has became one of the best souvenirs from Okinawa! In addition, you can buy various sweets such as; Chinsuko (a small biscuit made of mostly lard and flour), which is also one of the most loved traditional Okinawan sweets, Princess Moon (a cake with mango and citrus depressa), Shisa (a traditional Ryukuan decoration) shaped jellies, and more. You can buy your souvenirs and have your lunch at Okashi goten. Nago Pineapple Park is a theme park on the theme of pineapples where you can taste many kinds of pineapples and take a cart ride through the pineapple fields and even learn about harvesting pineapples! Okinawa Fruit Land is a tropical theme park where you can see various fruits, butterflies and birds and you can take a rest at fruit cafe, and also explore different kinds of themed zones. You can definitely have fun at these parks! *You will visit Nago Pineapple Park on even number days, and Okinawa fruit Land on odd number days. At Manza Cape, you can take a jaw-dropping photo of the beautiful ocean! The view from Manza Cape is fascinating and you can see a famous elephant-shaped rock. With its beautiful scenery and the clear ocean, it's one of the best tourist spots in Okinawa. Ryukyu Mura (Village) is a place where you can step back in time to see what life used to be like in the Ryuku Kingdom (1429 - 1879). Explore traditional buildings, watch Okinawan dance and listen to the traditional songs in Okinawa! This tour is available everyday from April 1st. Itinerary: *You can choose either Pick-up or Check-in for the meeting place. 08:50 (Check-in) Naha Bus Temporary Office 09:00 (Pick-up) Okinawa Miyako Hotel / Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle 10:50 Visit Churaumi Aquarium Ocean Expo Park (120 min) 13:15 Take lunch at Okashi goten (50 min) (Even number Days) Visit Nago Pineapple Park (50 min) (Odd number Days) Visit Okinawa Fruits Land (50 min) 15:45 Enjoy Manza Cape (20 min) 16:20 Enjoy Ryukyu Mura (60 min) Drop-offs at the following locations: Okinawa Miyako Hotel Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle Kokusai Street Bus Stops This tour ends at Naha Bus Terminal. Please get to the next destination on your own.
strTitle: Enjoy 5 Great Attractions in a bus tour from Naha, Okinawa

strIntroduction: This 1-Day tour explores the tropical Islands of Okinawa on a comfortable sightseeing bus, stopping by its main highlights and taking in its perfect landscapes! Starting at Palette Kumoji and continuing to Kouri Island where there is a 2 kilometer-bridge extending out to the middle of the glittering sea, you can stroll along to the Kouri Island and gaze at the outstanding ocean view! Then there is 150 minutes of free time at the Tropical Dream Center where you can discover the wildlife of the island close up as you explore the jungle filled with over 2,000 orchids and other colorful flowers! Here you can also choose some local lunch at the restaurant inside the Ocean Expo Center. If you have time, you can take a walk or trolley to the world class Churaumi Aquarium. The next stop is Yanbaru Ikoi no Mori Rest House where you can take a little break and treat yourself to an Okinawan dessert! Here you can pick up some souvenirs as well. The last stop is Ryukyu Village where you will learn about the ancient Ryukyu Okinawan culture while listening to its traditional music. There are daily performances of dances, charming Ryukyu houses to explore, and you can even have a chance to see a habu snake! It will be a fascinating and unforgettable experience!! Please note that this tour is mainly run for Japanese visitors, so there is only basic English assistance on the tour. Also if less than 2 participants are booked, the activity may be canceled.
strTitle: Explore Kouri Island and Ryukyu Village in Okinawa!

strIntroduction: Located just to the south of Tokyo, Kamakura is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Japan. The city is known for being the political capital pf Japan 8 centuries ago when Minamoto no Yoritomo established a military center there. Under a government upheld by samurai, a warrior culture flourished there that was very different from the aristocratic culture in Kyoto. You will see a simpleness and dynamism in its architectures and Buddhist images. We will show you around temples and shrines in Kamakura that date back to the days of old. ●Tour Itinerary -10:45 Meet at Enoden Kamakura Information Desk -11:00 Depart from Kamakura Station -11:00 Kenchoji Temple A Zen Temple started by Hojo Tokiyori, the 5th regent of the Kamakura Shogunate, it is famous for its main gate, “Sanmon” and a big temple bell, “bonsho”. -11:45 Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Shrine This shrine has been standing here since the 12 century in honor of the ancestors of Minamoto Yoritomo who established Kamakura as a military center of Japan. You may even have a chance to see a traditional wedding ceremony here. -12:30 Kamakuragu Shrine This Shinto Temple is dedicated to a tragic prince, “Morinaga-Shinno,” who was made a captive in a small cave for nine months before being executed. A shrine still exits in the cave. -Lunch Time Participants who booked the Lunch Plan will have a Deluxe Boxed Lunch at a traditional Japanese restaurant, Miyokawa,. Participants who chose the Without Lunch Plan will be dropped off at Kamakura Station, and picked up 60 minutes later. -14:45 Hasedera Temple Known as the Temple of the Flowers, Hasedera houses a big Buddhist statue of an eleven headed Kannon, the goddess of Mercy. It is believed to have been made around the 8th century. -14:55 Kotokuin Temple and the Great Buddha This temple is famous for its magnificent Daibutsu (Great Buddha) which rises 18m high, towering above the ground below. 15:30 Tour ends at Kamakura Station Attention: *About the One Day Plan Without Lunch You will have 60 minutes to have lunch once you have been dropped off at Kamakura Station. You will then meet up again with the group at the same location. Please make sure you are not late to meet the bus. If you would like to add the Lunch to your tour please tell the tour guide or check-in staff before the tour departs. Once the tour starts we will not be able to accept your order. Lunch will cost an additional 1500 JPY per person.
strTitle: Hop on a Bus for a Half Day Tour of Kamakura’s Best Sights!

strIntroduction: In this tour, you will be able to explore two of the beautiful islands of Okinawa, Kohama Island and Taketomi Island where you can relax and have lunch in a resort or stroll around in the afternoon. You can either meet at Ishigaki Port or use a pick-up service at hotels. The first stop on the tour is Kohama Island where you will ride a bus and cut through the roads surrounded by sugarcane farms while visiting locations from the Japanese TV drama, “Churasan”. You will also go to Kubazaki shore to see the neighboring Nishiomote and Yubu Islands. You will be amazed by its beautiful beach and ocean. If you choose the morning plan, you will have lunch at Haimurubushi Resort which is one of the highest ranked hotels on Kohama Island, with a 4.7 customer rating out of 5 points. Then you will go to Taketomi Island where you will experience a water buffalo ride. You can sit back and enjoy the ride and enjoy the island breeze while listening to traditional Okinawan folk songs. Then you'll return to Ishigaki Island where the tour ends at Ishigaki Port or at drop-off Hotels. More information about the morning plan *You can enjoy free-time 1.5 to 3 hours at the resort hotel, Haimurubushi. You can use the shower at the pool or beach during the summer. Also you can borrow a bath towel. *You can select a departure time from below: 1. Leave Ishigaki port at 9:40 and return to Ishigaki port at 17:10 2. Leave Ishigaki port at 11:10 and return to Ishigaki port at 17:10
strTitle: Explore the Beautiful Islands of Taketomi and Kohama!

strIntroduction: Founded in the early 8th century, Nara was Japan’s old capital, predating even Kyoto. On this tour, you will see many historic architectures and national treasures which reveal how Japan’s culture has been incorporated from the influences of other countries. ●Tour Itinerary -Todaiji Temple The symbol of Nara, famous for the world’s largest wooden buildings within which sits the Great Buddha. -Kasuga Taisha Shrine This ancient shrine, built in the 8th century, is known for its hundreds of metal lanterns and large sacred cedar tree which is believed to be 1000 years old! -Kofukuji Treasure House After visiting Kofukuji Temple, the tour takes you to the Treasure House in which various Buddhist works of art, from the Asuka to Edo periods, are exhibited. Above all, the six-armed image of Ashura is a masterpiece! The tour ends here. Feel free to check the exhibits at your own pace. *Please understand that due to the 60th ceremonial reconstruction after 20 years, the itinerary for Kasuga Taisha may differ from the original tour due to area closures.
strTitle: Half Day Bus Tour for Nara's Top Three World Heritage Sites

strIntroduction: Choose between a convenient morning or afternoon tour of Ishigaki Island, visiting sights like the turquoise Kabira Bay, the dragon-festooned Toujin Grave and the lush Yaeyamayashi palm tree forest. On the morning tour, stop for lunch overlooking the ocean, and sample Yaeyama-style cuisine. Ideal for guests who cannot drive, this is a hassle-free way to tour Ishigaki. The bus guides sing traditional Okinawan songs while accompanying themselves on the sanshin (a three-stringed banjo). As the morning tour stops at the airport, this is a great way to see more of Ishigaki before your flight! Course A: Morning Tour Accompanied by one of the island's famous local guides (and his sanshin), spend your morning visiting the main sights of Ishigaki. A lunch of Yaeyama-style dishes at a restaurant with great views is included. * Due to shifts and vacations, the local morning guide may not be available. The following will be the schedule: 09:00-09:40 Meet at Azuma Bus Terminal/Pick-up at your hotel. * Pick-up at the following hotels are free. Please inform us of your hotel beforehand. Guests picked up at Royal Marine Palace, Granvrio Hotel, Beach Hotel Sunshine or Fusaki Resort Village will miss seeing Tourinji Temple. ANA Intercontinental Ishigaki Resort at 9:00 Hotel Nikko Yaeyama at 9:10 Beach Hotel Sunshine at 9:40 Fusaki Resort Village at 9:40 Hotel Royal Marine Palace at 9:40 Ishigaki Resort Grandvrio at 9:40 Azuma Bus Terminal at 9:15 Tourinji Temple and Gongendo Shrine (from bus) Toujin Grave (10 min) Nagura Bay Pass by this bay, where the sea and mangroves meet (from bus) Kabira Park (40 min) The turquoise water of this beautiful bay is justly famous. You can take a glass-bottom boat ride to see the vibrant marine life! Yamabare Farm and lunch at Aunt Poza's Restaurant (40 min) Enjoy a meal of Yaeyama cuisine overlooking the sea. Komehara Palm Forest (20 min) Tamatorizaki Viewpoint (15 min) Smell the hibiscus on the wind, while overlooking the ocean and Ishigaki's coral reefs. 13:40 Drop-off at Ishigaki Airport Miyaragawa Mangroves (from bus) 14:00 Tour ends at Azuma Bus Terminal Course B: Afternoon Tour Accompanied by a female guide, join this afternoon tour enlivened by local island songs. A snack break is included. The following will be the schedule: 13:30-14:15 Meet at Azuma Bus Terminal/Pick-up at your hotel. * Pick-up at the following hotels is free. Please inform us of your hotel beforehand. ANA Intercontinental Ishigaki Resort at 13:30 Hotel Nikko Yaeyama at 13:40 Beach Hotel Sunshine at 14:10 Fusaki Resort Village at 14:15 Hotel Royal Marine Palace at 14:10 Ishigaki Resort Grandvrio at 14:10 Azuma Bus Terminal at 13:45 Tourinji Temple (from bus) Toujin Grave (10 min) Kabira Park (40 min) The turquoise water of this beautiful bay is justly famous. You can take a glass-bottom boat ride to see the vibrant marine life! Light snack at Yamabare Farm Komehara Palm Forest (20 min) Sokohara Dam (from bus) 17:50 Tour ends at Azuma Bus Terminal The following conditions will apply: * The activity schedule is subject to change or cancellation due to weather or traffic conditions. * Children 5 and under can join the tour for free when accompanied by an adult (1 child per adult). However, a seat and meal are not provided. Should you wish to reserve a seat or meal, please pay the Child's fee * Please select where you wish to board (hotel or bus terminal) when booking this activity. * At the bus terminal, please exchange your voucher for a ticket. * If you are picked up at the ANA Intercontinental or Hotel Nikko, please tell the driver your name, and then exchange the voucher for a ticket when you arrive at the bus terminal. * If you are picked up at the Royal Marine Palace Hotel, Grandvrio Hotel, Sunshine Hotel or Fusaki Resort, please give your voucher to the guide. * The tour itself will be conducted in Japanese, but the guide may speak very basic English. * If disabled guests show their "Disability Card" at the desk, their fee will be discounted to the Child's fee.
strTitle: Venture Out on Half-Day Island Tour of Ishigaki, Okinawa!

strIntroduction: From the turquoise Kabira Bay (with optional glass-bottom boat tour) to the Tamatori Viewpoint, enjoy Ishigaki's beautiful natural sights. In the afternoon, we'll visit Taketomi Island, taking in the red-roofed Ryukyu village from one of the famous water buffalo carts. Lunch at Aunt Pozu's restaurant is included. This hassle-free tour makes exploring the islands easy! The following will be the schedule: 08:50-09:30 Meet at Ishigaki Port/Pick-up at your hotel * The pick-up (and drop-off) at the following hotels is free. Please inform us of your hotel beforehand. Fusaki Resort Village at 8:50 Beach Hotel Sunshine at 8:55 Ishigaki Resort Grandvrio at 9:00 Hotel Royal Marine Palace at 9:02 Hotel Nikko Yaeyama at 9:15 Okinawa EXES Ishigakijima at 9:00 ANA Intercontinental Ishigaki Resort at 9:15 Hotel Best Inn Ishigakijima at 9:17 Arrive at Ishigaki Port Terminal at 9:30 09:30 Tour Starts Bus tour of Ishigaki Tourinji Temple (from bus) Toujin Grave Kabira Park (optional discounted glass-bottom boat tours) Lunch at Aunt Poza's Restaurant Bus Tour of Ishigaki Komehara Palm Forest Tamatorizaki Viewpoint Miyaragawa mangroves 14:45 Departure from Ishigaki Port Tour of Taketomi Water buffalo cart tour (with singing driver!) Departure from Taketomi Port Please choose between a 16:00, 17:00 or 17:40 return. Tour ends at Ishigaki Port/Drop-off at hotels The following conditions will apply: * The activity schedule is subject to change or cancellation due to weather or traffic conditions. * This tour is operated only in Japanese. * In case of rain, the tour will go ahead as scheduled. Please make sure to bring rain gear. * If you wish to ride the glass-bottom boat at Kabira Bay, payment will occur on location. * There will not be a guide on the boat to Taketomi, but a guide will be waiting for you on the island. * The tour will not run during Taketomi Island's Tanadui Festival in November.
strTitle: Enjoy A Full-Day Island Tour of Ishigaki and Taketomi!

strIntroduction: Okinawa cuisine has two different cultural histories. One is called Ryukyu style cuisine that has the original roots and influence of China, which had been served for treating state guests from China since old age in the Ryukyu Kingdom, The second one is called Okinawa cuisine, which has its influence from the US and other countries, after the world war. At this private cooking class, you can learn about Ryukyu style cuisine, improve your knowledge of the Okinawa's food history and culture by visiting a local market and seeing the authentic materials. It'll then be selected and purchased. Enjoy the experience as if you're living in Okinawa, simply by shopping at a local food market. Through this experience, you can get a glimpse into people's daily life in Okinawa, not only the food history and culture. The schedule of this experience will be carried as follows: 10:00 or 16:00 Meeting at Bunka Tenbusu building in Naha city. Head to the local market on foot. (About 3 minutes) Walk around the market, along with an explanation of the area. (About 20 minutes) Get a brief explanation about local food material with the information of Okinawa's food culture and traditional Okinawa. (About 20 minutes) Get advice on selecting the material and purchasing if you'd like. After shopping, we'll go to the school by car. (About 5 minutes) Experience the cooking practice of Okinawa and its specialty. (About 1.5 - 2 hours ) Enjoy your meal (About 30- 40 minutes) End of the class. Okinawa cuisine is popular among woman as a healthy food that has a beauty effect and longevity effect. Okinawa cuisine is made with various ingredients such as pork, tofu, beans, seasonal vegetable, and fresh seafood. After you've learned about Okinawa cuisine, you can try to reproduce the dishes of Ryukyu style food at your home country, Explore the new aspect of Japanese local cuisine from this cooking class!
strTitle: Learn to Cook Traditional Food From Okinawa in Naha

strIntroduction: Before transferring to Kyoto, the capital of Japan was founded in Nara. It was a time when the arrival of Buddhism had huge influences on culture, art, and architecture in Japan. In this tour, we'll visit ancient temples in Nara to learn how Buddhism began to take root in Japanese life. And we drop by “Suzaku-mon”, the restored front gate of Heijokyo Palace. ●Tour Itinerary >Start from JR Nara Station (at 13:55), or Kintetsu Nara Station (14:00). *Check in at the bus information center by 20 minutes before the bus departs. > Toshodaiji Temple Registered as UNESCO World Heritage Site, the temple was founded by Chinese monk, Jianzhen from the Tang Dynasty. The Golden Hall is a classical architecture of a single story. >Yakushiji Temple Founded by Emperor Temmu to pray for the recovery of his Empress from a serious illness. See a famous five-story pagoda and the Buddhist images on the national treasure list. Several times a year, Genjo-Sanzoin-Garan is open, which deifies a famous monk, Genjo Sanzo whose journey to India was fictionalized into a novel, “Saiyu-ki” or “Journey to the West”. > Suzakumon Gate Visit beautifully restored Suzakumon Gate on the remains of the Heijokyo Site. >Tour End Points 16:55 Arrive at JR Nara Station 17:00 Arrive at Kintetsu Nara Station at 17:00 *Please note that tour prices will vary according to the open period or closing period of the Yakushiji Genjo-Sanzoin temple. Genjo-Sanzoin Open Period: 2016 April 1 - June 30, Aug 13-15, Sept 16 - Nov 30 2017 Jan 1 - 15, March 1 - 31 Closing Period: 2016 July 1 - Aug 12, Aug 16 - Sept 15, Dec 1 - 31 2017 Jan 16 - Feb 28
strTitle: Explore Toshodaiji & Yakushiji Temple, Bus Tour in Nara!

strIntroduction: This tour is a great one day tour that offers you visits to four of The Yaeyama Islands! You will be visiting the wild Iriomote, where you will cruise through the lush mangrove forests. You will be crossing the shallow water to Yubujima with a water buffalo cart. You will have your lunch at Kohama, where you can enjoy the relaxing ambience of rural area. You can try Okinawa's food such as "goya champuru" or "Yaeyama soba" there. You will be visiting Taketomi in the end of the tour, where you can explore the Kaiji beach's "star sands", and the red roofed village of Shiisaa-laden. strIntroduction: Change into the exercise wear you brought with you and we will start the training. First we will teach you one secret breathing exercise of Goi-Jyu Ryu Karate. You will learn the fundamental movement of Karate. Then learn how to defense yourself from the opponent and offense. Mitt beating will be included in experience. After the experience we will have Kaiseki meal. The experience well take about an hour and meal will take about an another hour. The schedule might change every month. For this experience, come to our restaurant in Chiba. It is about 5 minutes walk from JR Chiba Station. Kaiseki is traditional Japanese cuisine from the Edo period. Did you know that in Japan, we have not only 4, but 72 different seasons traditionally? We express the beauty of those seasons in our cuisine. Food is all organic, no additives are used. We think food makes your body healthier and we serve only good food for you. We also have calligraphy experience, flower arrangement experience, tea ceremony experience, special kimono experience, sushi making experience, Aikido experience, and Japanese music instrument experience for you. Please, check them also from our profile. Thank you!
strTitle: Experience Karate & Kaiseki meal in Chiba

strIntroduction: This is a half-day tour to the local cities of Shimada and Kanaya in Shizuoka prefecture, Japan. Meet at Shimada Station of Tokaido local line in the early afternoon. I will pick you up at the south exit of the station. First, we will visit the Houraibashi bridge. With its length of 897.4 meters (approx.0.6 miles) and width of 2.4 meters (approx. 6 feet) it is listed in the Guinness Book of Records as the world's longest wooden footbridge. You can cross that bridge on foot. After walking I will drive you to the Ooi Shrine, where you can experience the Shinto prayer, and enjoy Japanese architecture & garden. Next you will visit the Shimada City Museum and Ruins of the Ooi river Crossing Toll Gate. Strolling around the old streets will take you back to the old age of the Edo period. Also, you can see the ordinary people's life of Showa period. You can also enjoy an woodblock print exhibition. If you like to buy some souvenirs, I can take you to good places to shop. Or you can rest with a cup of coffee. I can guide 1-4 people.
strTitle: Time slip to the Edo period with a local tour in Shizuoka

strIntroduction: Make a reservation and join this bus tour in Okinawa to visit Okinawa's famous sightseeing spots and to enjoy dinner with show at Urashima! You will be visiting the famous Churaumi Aquarium, which is a home to gigantic whale sharks, manta rays, and other marine creatures. You will also gaze over the wonderful Kouri Island Bridge, that stretches over the beautiful ocean of Okinawa. Explore the traditional side of Okinawa at Ryukyu Mura Village, where you can learn more about the unique Ryukyu Culture. You will have dinner with traditional dance show at Urashima, where you can enjoy the taste of local cuisine and watch the elegant Ryukyu dances. The itinerary for the tour is as follows: - 08:20 Meet at Palette Kumoji For those who want to depart from Palette Kumoji, please meet here. - 08:50 Meet at Omoromachi T Galleria For those who want to depart from Omoromachi T Galleria, please meet here. - 10:20 Kouri Island (20 min) - 11:30 Churaumi Aquarium and Lunch (~2.5 hours) Enjoy lunch by yourself at the cafe while gazing the fish in the blue tank. - 14:50 Okashi Goten (30 min) - 15:50 Ryukyu Mura Village (70 min) - 17:00 Depart for Palette Kumoji - 18:30 Arrive at Palette Kumoji and walk to Urashima (10 min) - 19:00 Enjoy dinner and traditional dances at Urashima! strIntroduction: This is a one day, round-trip tour from Okayama city to the ruins of Takeda Castle, including a delicious Japanese lunch. There are two meeting points; Kurashiki and Okayama station south parking area. Itinerary 6:30-7:55 Board the bus at your preferred location and head to Takeda Castle ruins. You will stop en route to the castle to indulge in a traditional Japanese lunch consisting on beef and abalone. Once at the site, you will be amazed at the magnificent panorama of the ruins at the top of the mountain, covered in clouds, making it look like a floating castle in the sky. This castle was built in the 15th century and it's mystic appearance has earned it the nickname "The Machu Picchu of Japan". After the visit, you will head back by bus to Okayama to be dropped off at your preferred meeting point.
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-day tour of the Takeda Castle ruins from Okayama!

strIntroduction: This is a two day tour departing from Tokyo to western Japan, visiting iconic sights like the Himeji Castle, the Takeda Castle ruins, as well as central Kobe. Itinerary DAY 1 9:30 am Departure from Tokyo's Haneda airport on a direct flight to Osaka's Itami Airport, where you will then transfer to a boat cruise to explore Kobe port and take in the magnificent views of the city from the water. You will then stroll around Kobe's Kitano district, home to enormous residences featuring Western style architecture. This is where some of the first foreigner diplomats and expats settled in Japan back in the Meiji era. You will then check-in at Hotel Monterey Kobe, and then you'll have the rest of the day free to explore Kobe on your own. Your hotel is situated in the bustling downtown area, within walking distance to another Kobe sight: Chinatown. An area filled with Chinese restaurants that is perhaps most enjoyed by eating several small-sized bites delicacies at different stores such as Peking duck rolls or dumplings. For dinner, you could perhaps find a fine restaurant to try the world-famous Kobe beef and treat yourself to a delicious steak. For an extra fee, you could head to the Arima hot spring situated on top of Mt. Rokko, offering you magnificent views of this vibrant city while you relax in hot water. (towel included). DAY 2 Have breakfast at your hotel and check-out. You will then visit the ruins of Takeda castle, built in the 15th century, it's located at the top of a mountain, which is why it has earned the nickname "The Machu Picchu of Japan" Then, you will visit Himeji Castle, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a National Treasure of Japan. It is finally open after years of restoration. Don't forget to visit Koko-en garden as well. After the visit, you will flight back to Tokyo Haneda airport where the tour ends.
strTitle: Visit Himeji and Takeda Castles in a 2-Day Tour from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: On this 1 day tour with an English guide in Kyoto, you can ride the Sagano Romantic Train, stroll around Arashiyama including Tenryuji Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage site, visit a bamboo forest, and enjoy a Hozugawa River Boat Ride! To start this exciting tour, you will visit Tenryuji Temple which was established in 1339 and was Japan's first Zen temple and was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage building in 1994. At Tenryuji Temple you can see beautiful gardens and historical buildings such as Hatto (Dharma Hall), Kuri (Temple Living Quarters), Hojo (Abbot's Quarters), and more. You will be especially excited if you are interested in learning the history of Japan! Next, you will visit the bamboo forest, which is one of the most popular tourist spots in Kyoto. Here you can see thousands of bamboos lining the path making the experience feel like you are in a fantasy story. The photos you take here will be a great souvenir to show your family and friends! After 10 minutes walking from the bamboo forest, you will be able to take a ride on the Sagano Romantic Train! From the train, you can see the fascinating scenery of Arashiyama and the Hozugawa River which will be your next stops. The Hozugawa River Boat Ride will be an unforgettable memory of your Kyoto trip! On the boat, you will enjoy an exciting 16 kilometer, two hour journey! During all seasons, you can see the beautiful view: Cherry blossoms falling in the river wind in spring, Rock azalea and frogs singing in summer, gorgeous red autumn leaves in autumn, and the ravine with snow in winter. Don't miss this chance to fully enjoy Kyoto with this day trip! This tour is available everyday. Itinerary: Meet your guide at Kyoto station Move to JR Sagano-Arashiyama station by train (20min) Visit Tenryuji Temple and stroll the bamboo forest (60 min) Ride on the Sagano Romantic Train from Trocco Arashiyama station (25 min) Arrive at Trocco Kameoka station Move to Kameoka boarding area by bus Enjoy Hozugawa River Boat Ride! (120 min) Arrive at Arashiyama drop-off point Walk to JR Sagano-Arashiyama station (15 min) Get back at Kyoto station by train (20 min) *This tour ends at Kyoto station. Please go to your next destination on your own. The price only includes the Guide Fee. In addition to the price, there are other fees depending on your tour. Admission Fee: 600 JPY (Adlut) / 400 JPY (Child:Age 6-11) Transportation Fee: About 1400 JPY (Adult) / 860 JPY (Child:Age 6 -11) / 550 JPY (Infant:Age 0-5) Activity Fee: 4100 JPY (Adult) / 2700 JPY (Child: Age 0 -11)
strTitle: Enjoy Sagano Trocco, Stroll Arashiyama&River Boat Ride,Kyoto

strIntroduction: Due to the cold weather, cherry blossom season in Hokkaido often comes later than other areas of Japan, which offers a great opportunity for tourists to experience once more, such a beautiful scenery. First we'll go to the beautiful Kitanomori garden in Kamikawa where we'll see some beautiful seasonal flowers. Visit Shibazakura Takinoue Park to wander through the endless field of adorable pink blossoms that bloom only for a short period of time, creating a unique landscape. Then we'll head to Kamiyubetsu Tulip Park and take into the fabulous view of 1.2 million tulips creating a gorgeous flower carpet. And don't forget to enjoy a bento lunch and some local sweets as you enjoy the spring time season. Below is the schedule of the tour: 7:50 to 8:30 am: Depart from Sapporo Station - visit Kitanomori Garden (20 min) - visit Shibazakura Takinoue Park (60 min) - visit Kamiyubetsu Tulip Park (70 min) 20:15 to 21:15 pm: Return to Sapporo, end of tour Please choose the correct option according to the tour date: Price A: May 10, 12, 15, 16, 17, 18, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26, 29, 30, 31, June 1, 2 Price B: May 13, 14, 20, 21, 28, June 3 Price C: May 11, 19, 27, June 4 This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
